query.0: What is the primary objective of the Capital Works Management Framework?
query.1: Under the new Public Works Contracts, who is responsible for design in a Traditional Contract?
query.2: Which of the following is NOT a key change introduced by the new Public Works Contracts?
query.3: What is the purpose of Programme Contingency?
query.4: In the new contracts, what replaces the role of nominated subcontractors?
query.5: Which clause in the Schedule Part 1 allows the Employer to allocate risk for unforeseeable ground conditions?
query.6: What is the default retention percentage specified in the Schedule Part 1?
query.7: Under the Design and Build Contract, who is responsible for ensuring the Works are fit for purpose?
query.8: Which of the following is a Compensation Event under the Traditional Contract?
query.9: What is the maximum period for which the Contractor must maintain Professional Indemnity insurance after Substantial Completion?
query.10: Which document defines the Contractor's daily delay costs for Compensation Events?
query.11: What is the consequence if the Contractor fails to provide a revised programme upon request?
query.12: Under which clause can the Employer reject the entire Works due to serious defects?
query.13: What is the primary purpose of the Letter of Acceptance?
query.14: Which of the following is NOT an Employer's Risk under Clause 3.1?
query.15: What is the default appointing body for conciliation if none is specified in the Schedule?
query.16: Under Clause 5.3, what must the Contractor ensure regarding workpersons' wages?
query.17: Which clause allows the Employer to deduct estimated unpaid wages from the Contractor?
query.18: What is the Contractor's obligation under Clause 7.8 if archaeological artefacts are found?
query.19: Which clause governs the Contractor's responsibility for Site security?
query.20: What is the primary purpose of the Works Requirements in a Design and Build Contract?
query.21: Under Clause 4.5, when must the ER issue a Change Order?
query.22: What is the time limit for the ER to object to a Contractor's submission under Clause 4.7?
query.23: Which clause allows the Employer to terminate the Contract if the Starting Date does not occur?
query.24: What is the Contractor's liability for design by Specialists?
query.25: Which clause requires the Contractor to provide a Quality Assurance system?
query.26: What is the Contractor's obligation under Clause 7.10 on completion?
query.27: Under Clause 11.5, when must the ER issue the penultimate payment certificate?
query.28: Which clause governs the Contractor's right to suspend work for non-payment?
query.29: What is the primary purpose of the Pricing Document?
query.30: Under Clause 3.7, when is Professional Indemnity insurance required?
query.31: What is the Contractor's obligation under Clause 4.16 regarding confidentiality?
query.32: Which clause allows the ER to extend the Defects Period?
query.33: What is the Contractor's responsibility under Clause 8.1 in a Traditional Contract?
query.34: Under Clause 10.8, which Price Variation option is the default?
query.35: What is the Employer's entitlement under Clause 8.5.3 if the Contractor fails to rectify defects?
query.36: Which clause governs the Contractor's obligation to provide collateral warranties?
query.37: What is the purpose of the Defects Certificate?
query.38: Under Clause 4.3, who appoints the Employer's Representative?
query.39: Which clause governs the Contractor's right to claim for unforeseen utilities delays?
query.40: What is the Contractor's obligation under Clause 7.7 regarding setting out?
query.41: Under Clause 3.6, who is covered by the Contractor's Public Liability insurance?
query.42: Which clause allows the ER to instruct the Contractor to search for defects?
query.43: 44. What is the Contractor's obligation under Clause 4.9 regarding the programme?
query.44: Under Clause 11.2, what is the default percentage for valuing unfixed Works Items in interim payments?
query.45: Which clause governs the Contractor's responsibility for existing property damage?
query.46: What is the Contractor's obligation under Clause 4.14 regarding communications?
query.47: Under Clause 12.6, what must the ER determine within 10 working days of termination?
query.48: Which clause allows the Employer to require random checks on wage records?
query.49: What is the primary purpose of the Agreement document?

expected.0: To ensure cost certainty, value for money, and efficient project delivery
expected.3: To account for delays and costs arising from Compensation Events
expected.8: Unforeseeable ground conditions (if allocated to the Employer)
expected.15: Chartered Institute of Arbitrators Irish Branch
expected.16: Wages are never more than a month in arrears
expected.18: Preserve them and notify the Employer
expected.20: To specify performance or output criteria
expected.21: When it is physically impossible to comply with the Works Requirements
expected.24: Full liability as if the design were their own
expected.26: To leave the Site in a proper condition
expected.27: Within 3 months of the final statement
expected.29: To evaluate tenders and value change orders
expected.30: If specified in the Schedule Part 1D
expected.31: To protect commercially sensitive information for 5 years
expected.33: Fitness for purpose of Works Items they select
expected.35: To have the work done by others at the Contractor's cost
expected.37: To confirm all defects have been rectified
expected.40: To check information before setting out
expected.41: The Contractor and Employer as co-insured
expected.43: To submit a detailed programme before the Starting Date
expected.49: To confirm the Contract Sum and parties

pertub_query.0: What is the fundamental purpose or goal of the Capital Works Management Framework?
pertub_query.1: Who bears responsibility for designing under a traditional public works contract framework?
pertub_query.2: What aspect of public procurement was not a fundamental shift brought about by the revamped Public Works Contracts?
pertub_query.3: What is the intended function or objective behind including a contingency plan in a program?
pertub_query.4: What entities or structures assume the responsibilities previously assigned to nominated subcontractors in the current contracts?
pertub_query.5: Which provision within Schedule Part 1 enables the Employer to assume responsibility for unforeseen subsidence or soil conditions?
pertub_query.6: What retention percentage is set as the standard in Schedule Part 1 by default?
pertub_query.7: Under what terms do the parties in the Design and Build Contract share the responsibility for verifying that the completed work meets its intended objectives?
pertub_query.8: What type of event triggers compensation under the terms specified in the Traditional Contract?
pertub_query.9: What length of time must the contractor keep professional indemnity insurance in force following substantial completion?
pertub_query.10: What specification or contract clause outlines the Contractor's daily delay charges associated with Compensation Events?
pertub_query.11: What would be the outcome if the Contractor were to neglect supplying an updated project schedule as requested?
pertub_query.12: Under what provision can the Employer refuse to accept the entire project because of significant flaws?
pertub_query.13: What function or objective does the Letter of Acceptance serve primarily?
pertub_query.14: What provision in Clause 3.1 does not fall under an Employer's liability?
pertub_query.15: What institution or authority assumes conciliation duties when no designated body is mentioned in the statutory framework?
pertub_query.16: What provisions must the Contractor comply with under Clause 5.3 in regard to ensuring fair compensation for all workpersons employed on the project?
pertub_query.17: Which provision enables the Employer to offset the estimated unpaid wages against the Contractor's account?
pertub_query.18: What are the Contractor's responsibilities outlined in Clause 7.8 when discovering archaeological relics?
pertub_query.19: What section of the contract is liable for outlining the Contractor's accountability for site safety?
pertub_query.20: What is the main objective served by the Works Requirements clause in a design and build contract agreement?
pertub_query.21: What triggers an EOR (Equivalent Replacement) to prepare a Change Order under Clause 4.5 of the contract?
pertub_query.22: How long does the ER (Emergency Response) have to submit an objection to a contractor's proposal in relation to Clause 4.7?
pertub_query.23: What provision in the contract permits the Employer to cancel their obligations if the commencement date specified does not take place?
pertub_query.24: What responsibility does the Contractor assume in regard to the work of Specialist designers?
pertub_query.25: What contractual provision necessitates the Contractor to implement a Quality Assurance system?
pertub_query.26: What responsibilities does the contractor have to fulfill by the completion date specified in Section 7, Subsection 10 of the contract agreement?
pertub_query.27: Under what conditions does the ER have to submit the penultimate payment certificate according to Clause 11.5?
pertub_query.28: What provision in the contract grants the Contractor the authority to temporarily halt work due to non-payment?
pertub_query.29: What is the principal intention behind the Pricing Document?
pertub_query.30: What circumstances necessitate the provision of Professional Indemnity insurance under Section 3.7 of the relevant clause?
pertub_query.31: What are the Contractor's responsibilities concerning secrecy as outlined in Clause 4.16?
pertub_query.32: What provision enables the ER to prolong the Defects Period?
pertub_query.33: What obligations does the Contractor have to fulfill according to Section 8.1 of a traditional contract agreement?
pertub_query.34: Which Price Variation option specified in Clause 10.8 is considered the standard choice?
pertub_query.35: What recourse does the Employer have under Clause 8.5.3 in the event that the Contractor fails to correct deficiencies?
pertub_query.36: What provision in the contract stipulates the Contractor's liability for providing collateral warranties?
pertub_query.37: What function does the Defects Certificate serve?
pertub_query.38: Who is authorized to make the appointment of the Employer's Representative under Clause 4.3?
pertub_query.39: What contractual provision is responsible for regulating the Contractor's ability to file a claim due to unexpected utility delays?
pertub_query.40: What specific responsibilities does the Contractor have to fulfill in accordance with Clause 7.7 of the contract, specifically concerning site preparation and layout?
pertub_query.41: Who falls within the scope of coverage under Clause 3.6 of the Contractor's Public Liability insurance policy?
pertub_query.42: What provision in the contract empowers the ER to direct the Contractor's investigation into potential defects?
pertub_query.43: What are the contractor's responsibilities as outlined in Clause 4.9 with regard to the project timeline?
pertub_query.44: What is the standard rate assigned to unallocated Work Item under Section 11.2 for calculating interim payment amounts?
pertub_query.45: Which provision assumes liability for the existing property damage incurred by the Contractor?
pertub_query.46: What are the Contractor's responsibilities outlined in Clause 4.14 concerning communication with [who/what]?
pertub_query.47: What specific information or action does the ER need to assess and report back to within 10 working days following an employee's termination, as outlined in Clause 12.6?
pertub_query.48: What provision in the law permits the Employer to conduct unannounced audits of employee wage records?
pertub_query.49: What is the main objective or scope of the Agreement document?
